function.description: Allows the user to enter their weight in either kilograms or pounds.
Allows the user to enter their height in either centimeters or feet and inches.
Provides options for selecting preferred units (metric or imperial) for weight and height.
Calculates the BMI based on the entered weight and height.
Displays the calculated BMI value.
Provides an interpretation of the BMI result (e.g., underweight, normal weight, overweight, obese).
Allows the user to clear the entered weight and height values.
Choose the currency I want to convert from a dropdown list.
Choose the currency I want to convert to from a dropdown list.
Type in the numerical amount of the source currency I want to convert.
See the calculated equivalent in the target currency immediately after entering the amount or clicking a 'Convert' button.
View the current exchange rate being used for the conversion.
Easily switch the source and target currencies with a single click or button.
See a list of my previous currency conversions with details like date, time, source currency, target currency, amount, and converted amount.
Delete all saved conversion history data.
Choose my preferred source and target currencies so they are pre-selected when I open the converter.
Specify the number of decimal places to display in the converted amount.
Set the desired length of the generated password using a slider or input field.
Choose whether to include lowercase letters (a-z) in the password.
Choose whether to include uppercase letters (A-Z) in the password.
Choose whether to include numbers (0-9) in the password.
Choose whether to include symbols (!@#$%^&* etc.) in the password.
Option to exclude similar characters like i, l, 1, o, 0, etc.
Clicking this button generates a new password based on the selected criteria.
Clearly display the newly generated password.
Provide a button or functionality to easily copy the generated password to the clipboard.
Visually indicate the strength of the generated password (e.g., weak, medium, strong).
Type or paste the text or URL I want to encode in the QR code.
Click a button to generate the QR code based on my input.
Download the generated QR code image in various formats (e.g., PNG, SVG, JPG).
Change the color, add a logo, or adjust other visual aspects of the QR code.
Choose the color of the QR code modules and background.
Upload a logo image to be embedded in the center of the QR code.
Change the size and scale of the QR code.
Choose the level of error correction to make the QR code readable even if partially damaged.
Choose the output format for the QR code image (e.g., PNG, SVG, JPG)
See a history or gallery of my past generated QR codes.
Download previously generated QR codes again.
Remove unwanted QR codes from my history.
Read information about the creators of the QR code generator.
Find contact information for support or feedback.
Type or paste Markdown text into an input area.
Click a button to convert the Markdown input into HTML.
View the generated HTML in a separate output area.
Copy the generated HTML to the clipboard.
Clear the Markdown input area.
Clear the HTML output area.
Enable or disable syntax highlighting in the HTML output.
Select different themes for the HTML output's appearance.
Specify the number of spaces for tab indentation in the HTML output.
Enable live conversion of Markdown to HTML as you type.
See examples of common Markdown syntax and their corresponding HTML output.
Find detailed instructions and explanations about using the converter.
See all current tasks in a list format.
Create a new task with title, description (optional), due date (optional), and priority (optional).
Check off a task as finished.
Modify the details of an existing task, like title, description, due date, and priority.
Remove a task from the list.
Display tasks based on criteria such as completion status, due date, or priority.
Arrange tasks by attributes like due date, priority, or creation date.
Visualize the percentage of completed tasks over time.
See the distribution of tasks based on different categories or criteria (e.g., priority levels).
Track the number of tasks past their due dates.
Analyze the time spent on completing tasks (requires time tracking feature in todo app).
Set a target number of tasks to complete each day.
Choose a preferred visual theme for the app's interface.
Configure reminders and notifications for upcoming deadlines.
Create a new account with email and password.
Access existing account with email and password.
Explore the app's features with a sample account.
See the total available funds.
Visualize balance changes over time.

See a list of all recorded transactions.
Establish spending limits for different categories.
Record money received.
Record money spent.
Assign a category to each transaction (e.g., Food, Rent, Utilities).
Modify existing transaction details.
Remove a recorded transaction.
Display transactions based on date range, category, or other criteria.
Find specific transactions using keywords.
Define a new spending category (e.g., Groceries, Entertainment).
Assign a spending limit to each category.
Track spending against the budget for each category.
Modify existing budget categories or limits.
Remove a budget category.
See a breakdown of expenses by category.
Compare total income and expenses over a specific period.
Create a custom report based on selected criteria.
Download report data in various formats (e.g., CSV, PDF).
Update account password.
Edit personal details.
Configure app notifications (e.g., budget alerts).
Access help documentation or contact customer support.
Sign out of the application.
Display the current month's calendar with today's date highlighted.
Switch to different months (previous or next).
Switch to different years.
Create a new event for a specific day and time.
See details of an event, including title, time, and description.
Modify existing event details.
Remove an event from the calendar.
See a list of events scheduled for a specific day.
Get an overview of all events scheduled for the month.
Configure reminders for events.
Select preferred calendar display format (e.g., week view).
Control how event notifications are delivered.
The chatbot should understand what I'm saying, even if I don't use perfect grammar or spelling.
The chatbot's responses should be relevant to my questions and requests.
The chatbot should be able to answer my questions accurately and provide useful information.
The chatbot should get better at understanding and responding to my needs over time.
The interface for interacting with the chatbot should be simple and intuitive.
The chatbot should be able to communicate in multiple languages.
The chatbot should be able to tailor its responses to my individual preferences.
The chatbot should be available to help me whenever I need it.
The chatbot should be able to integrate with other apps and services I use.
My interactions with the chatbot should be kept confidential.
The pricing plans for the chatbot should be clear and easy to understand.
There should be different pricing plans to choose from, depending on my needs.
I should be able to try out the chatbot for free before I commit to a paid plan.
I should be able to easily contact the chatbot provider with any questions or issues.
The chatbot provider should offer email support.
The chatbot provider should offer phone support.
The chatbot provider should offer live chat support.
Allows new users to create an account.
Allows existing users to access their account.
Provides information about the app and its features.
Shows a demonstration of how the app works.
Allows users to record the food they consume.
Displays the user's daily calorie intake.
Allows users to set daily or weekly calorie goals.
Shows the user's progress towards their goals in charts and graphs.
Displays a breakdown of calories by macronutrients (carbohydrates, protein, and fat).
Allows users to search for food items by name.
Allows users to scan the barcode of food items to quickly add them to their log.
Allows users to create custom food items with their own nutritional information.
Allows users to edit or delete existing food entries.
Displays detailed nutritional information for each food item.
Displays a summary of the user's calorie intake and macronutrient breakdown for the day.
Displays a summary of the user's calorie intake and macronutrient breakdown for the week.
Displays a summary of the user's calorie intake and macronutrient breakdown for the month.
Allows users to generate custom reports based on specific date ranges.
Allows users to export their data in various formats (e.g., CSV, PDF).
Displays interactive charts visualizing calorie intake, macronutrient breakdown, and weight progress over time.
Allows users to update their personal information.
Allows users to change their account password.
Allows users to customize their notification settings.
Allows users to connect the app with other fitness or health apps.
Allows users to delete their account.
Show a welcome message or introduction to the password generator.
Button to the password generator page.
Provide information about the purpose and functionality of the website.
Allows employees to submit new expense claims with details such as amount, description, and supporting documents for different expense categories (Travel, Labor, Management, Equipment).
Allows employees to view the status (Approved, Rejected, Pending) of their submitted claims.
Allows employees to view a history of all their submitted claims, including details and status.
Displays a list of all pending claims submitted by employees.
Allows the administrator to review claim details and either approve or reject them.
Allows the administrator to view detailed information about a specific claim, including supporting documents.
Provides tools and visualizations to monitor expenses against the defined budget for each expense category (Travel, Labor, Management, Equipment).
Allows the administrator to generate reports summarizing expense data, such as total expenses per category, expenses over time, etc.
Allows the administrator to set and adjust the budget for each expense category.
Display a list of all customers with their name, company, and phone number.

Edit the information of an existing customer.
Delete a customer from the system.
View detailed information about a specific customer, including name, birthday, age, sex, company, phone number, preferred products, and purchase history.

Search for a specific product by name or category.

Edit the information of an existing product.
Delete a product from the system.
Display a list of all purchase records with date, product, customer, quantity, and amount.
Search for purchase records by customer, product, or date range.
Add a new purchase record to the system.
Edit an existing purchase record.
Delete a purchase record from the system.
Generate a report showing sales figures over a specified date range.
Generate a report showing sales figures for each product.
Generate a report showing sales figures for each customer.
Segment customers based on demographics or purchase history.
Analyze the performance of different products based on sales data.
Identify sales trends over time.
Access and view the content of the helloworld page, which should display the text 'helloworld'.

Displays the heading 'Hello, World!' on the page.
Reads the subject list from the specified Excel file ('Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx').
Transforms the subject list into a two-dimensional table with weekdays and time periods.
Saves the generated subject table to a new Excel file ('SubjectTable.xlsx').
Creates a lagged version of the 'result' column to use as the dependent variable.
Builds a logistic regression model using all other columns as predictors.
Saves the model summary statistics to an Excel file.
Reads data from a CSV file named 'Deathlist.csv'.
Calculates the number of deaths for each week of the year.
Creates a text-based histogram representing the weekly death counts.

Use keywords to find blog posts related to specific interests.
Browse blog posts by category or tag.
